Description: Gold circular medallion. This medallion is made out of sheet gold worked over a bronze former, the finer details being tooled by hand. The disc has three loops soldered to the back, probably for the attachment of chains. This element would have been part of a larger ensemble of chains and medallion pendants that was perhaps worn over the upper body. Aphrodite wears a stephane (diadem), behind which is a veil. She wears a chiton (tunic), which is pinned on the right side but slips down to reveal her shoulder. Prominent Venus rings, or wrinkles, are shown on the turning neck. The goddess is seated on a high-backed throne, while a small, winged Eros is perched on her shoulder.

Condition: The medallion is complete but misshapen, and the outer edge is buckled and slightly cracked. The damage has also distorted the figures.
Acquisition notes: Purchased at a sale of Castellani's antiquities in Paris, 1884, catalogue number 99.
